page.title: 03CLIMATE OF THE AREA
page.content: With altitude of the land varying between 500' and 1800' there is obviously quite a varied climate. The valley sides are steep and in winter, little sun can get onto the floor. Temperature ranges between -20C to + 28C. In well sheltered areas it can become very warm on fine summer days. Winters are varied ranging between mild, wet spells and arctic- like blizzards. The hill tops have a much more severe climate with more wind and rain (35"+). Snow can lie in gullies from December to April with a general snow cover over 1500' for more than 40 days in the winter.
